timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            	COMMENT Color names referencing a material or object refer to their vanilla MineCraft textures, not their real-world counterparts, eg. "emerald green."
          
          
            
            	COMMENT Color names refer to a material or an object which refers to their vanilla Minecraft textures, not their real-world counterparts, eg. "emerald green."
          
      
    
    
  

Even after my suggestion I do believe this needs another look from someone else.
timeline.author: i509VCB
timeline.diffHunk:

 	COMMENT Represents the surface color of a block when rendered from the {@link net.minecraft.client.gui.MapRenderer}.
-	FIELD field_15976 CLAY Lnet/minecraft/class_3620;
+	COMMENT Color names referencing a material or object refer to their vanilla MineCraft textures, not their real-world counterparts, eg. "emerald green."

timeline.bodyText: Slightly incorrect as this doesn't apply to all of them. (for example, BROWN or OFF_WHITE)
timeline.author: Juuxel
timeline.diffHunk: @@ -1,67 +1,69 @@ CLASS net/minecraft/class_3620 net/minecraft/block/MapColor COMMENT Represents the surface color of a block when rendered from the {@link net.minecraft.client.gui.MapRenderer}. - FIELD field_15976 CLAY Lnet/minecraft/class_3620; + COMMENT Color names refer to a material or an object which refers to their vanilla Minecraft textures, not their real-world counterparts, eg. "emerald green". + COMMENT Names are in the form of blockReference_baseColor.

replies.bodyText: Uh, why was this resolved? It's still not true as all names are not in that form.
replies.author: Juuxel

timeline.bodyText: What about just STONE_GRAY? That's a bit more descriptive.
timeline.author: Juuxel
